{"step_by_step_thinking": "Periodontal disease, also known as gum disease, is primarily caused by bacteria that accumulate on the teeth and gums. Bacteroides, Wolinella, and Eikenella are all types of bacteria that have been implicated in the etiology of periodontal disease. Neisseria, on the other hand, is a genus of bacteria that is typically associated with diseases like meningitis and gonorrhea, not periodontal disease.", "answer_choice": "C. Neisseria"}
